clinical_study.brief_title: A Single Center Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ETC 1002 in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Placebo-Controlled, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel Group, Single Center Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ETC 1002 in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase 2 study will asses the LDL-C lowering efficacy of ETC-1002 versus placebo in subjects with type 2 diabetes.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: assess the LDL-C lowering efficacy of ETC-1002 versus placebo in subjects with type 2 diabetes
primary_outcome.description: evaluate the change in LDL-C from baseline to various time points

secondary_outcome.measure: assess the effect of ETC-1002 versus placebo on glycemic parameters including fasting plasma and postprandial glucose and insulin
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate the change in glucose and insulin from baseline to various time points

secondary_outcome.measure: assess the effect of ETC-1002 versus placebo on measures of insulin sensitivity in subjects with type 2 diabetes
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate the change in HOMA-IR from baseline to various time points

secondary_outcome.measure: assess safety using adverse event reports, physical exams, vital signs, ECGs and clinical laboratory parameters
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate any changes in safety parameters during the course of the study.

arm_group.description: ETC-1002 daily Weeks 1-2, 80 mg/day; Weeks 3-4, 120 mg/day
